page.title: 01South of Newbridge on Wye
page.content: This area is predominantly farmland but with sweeping vistas of deciduous trees. The lovely river Wye curves snakelike through the valley which features the Wye Valley walk. Several areas contain carvan and camping sites.The countryside as a whole is beautiful and unspoilt. Most farms dotted around are privately owned and managed by the farmer and his family. Having both upland and meadow the farms are mainly concerned with sheep and cattle rearing but some horses too can be seen.Due to the number of trees available on their land several farms have quantities of timber cut and stacked. One farm has a haulage contracting business. Most farms have agricultural implements, cutting tools and tractors. Sophisticated farming machinery is not in evidence as cultivated ground is small.
